revised_title: William Bullerwell: A Life of Science and Music
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of William Bullerwell, a distinguished geophysicist and Deputy Director of the Institute of Geological Sciences. Born into a family with a tradition of teaching and farming, Bullerwell showed early interest in both Earth sciences and music. He pursued his academic career in physics and geology, winning awards and earning degrees from Durham University. During World War II, Bullerwell served in the Royal Artillery and contributed to radar technology development. After the war, he joined the Geological Survey of Great Britain, where he established a geophysical unit and made significant contributions to geological mapping and mineral discoveries. Throughout his life, Bullerwell remained passionate about music, playing various instruments and sharing his love for music with others.
